ygData.subject: Re: RE: negativity
ygData.msgSnippet: Well hey I tried the AC burger for a short time.  It sure didnt sit with my stomach well.  But MS did give me a tshirt to try to get me to keep playing. Maybe
ygData.messageBody:
Well hey I tried the AC burger for a short time. It sure didnt sit with my
stomach well. But MS did give me a tshirt to try to get me to keep playing.
Maybe we should all beg for new shirts, hehe.


----- Original Message -----
From: Kimes, Dean W. <Dean_Kimes@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, February 03, 2000 6:14 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] RE: negativity


> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> I found the 'food' at All you can UO wasn't filling me up. I was starving
> eating at that place. I wasn't impressed with chez-AC, but I can say it
> never crashed for me or anyone at work who plays it.
>
> Kit
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Wayne Sheppard [mailto:mrwayne@...]
> Sent: Thursday, February 03, 2000 4:14 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] RE: negativity
>
>
> From: "Wayne Sheppard" <mrwayne@...>
>
> > Date: Thu, 3 Feb 2000 14:42:29 -0700
> > From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
> > Subject: RE: negativity
> >
> >
> > I have one comment Ariell. I can choose to go to other restaurant
easily.
> > If the restaurant in your example served the only edible food in 5000
> miles
> > I expect you would go back the very next night and every one after that.
> > All the while complaining in hopes they would change. That's the
> situation
> > in EQ.
>
> Actually there is an AC burger joint and a UO buffet within walking
distance
> of the EQ steakhouse. We keep eating at EQ because, even with all its
> faults, a bad steak is better than a crappy burger.
>
>
> Wayne
>
>
